item.title: Sowing the Seeds of My Digital Garden
item.description: With Linux being my primary OS for development and daily use, I come across a lot of new things (Linux-specific and otherwise) on the daily, which help improve my development experience and sometimes increase productivity. This blog digital garden will hopefully serve as a index for those findings, and an excuse for me to properly research and document them for myself and others. The inspiration for me to use the term “digital garden” should be primarily attributed to this post by Joel Hooks, which in turn led me to another interesting piece, building a digital garden by Tom Critchlow.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Some projects I’ve worked on and contributed to include: One-click attendance using facial recognition: Our submission for YI (Young Indians) InnovIndia-2020 Virtual Hackathon 2020 conducted on the 31st July, 2020. We were one among the two winners from Mysuru. Tic-Tac-Toe Android game: Single-player Tic-Tac-Toe game implementing the Monte-Carlo tree search algorithm, in Java. Apart from these, I’ve worked on some projects as part of my academics: Developed a simple university practical examination scheduling system as part of my database management systems course.

item.title: Uses
item.description: Editor + Terminal I use Konsole that ships with the KDE Plasma desktop environment with zsh along with zinit plugin manager and powerlevel10k theme on my Arch Linux system. I use VS Code with the Ayu Dark theme for most of my development work. The only exception is when I’m working on something Android related, for which I use Android Studio. I also tend to use micro for quick edits on the terminal.
